gov.usgs.anss.cwbqueryclient

Class SacSegmentOutputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.cwbqueryclient.Outputer
      • gov.usgs.anss.cwbqueryclient.SacSegmentOutputer

  • public class SacSegmentOutputer
extends Outputer
    Take the CWBQuery list of MiniSEED blocks and create a SAC file(s) from each segment with some options. 
     switch  args   Description
 -fill   value  Change value from the SAC default of -12345
 -sacpz         If present, write out the SAC style Poles and Zeros file for the instrument stages
 -nogaps        If any gap is present, return nothing
 -sactrim       If present, do not fill out and end-of-interval gap with nodata values, just shorten the nsamps
 -nometa        If present, do not populate the SAC header with coordinates, etc from the MetaDataServer
 -pgm   level   Set the minimum level of acceleration needed to write out the file in % g.
 -q             Quiet - less output
 -derivelh      If present, change the input sample rate to 1 hz after lowpass and decimage
 -cosmos        Create a COSMOS file instead of a SAC file

      • getSacTimeSeries

        public SacTimeSeries getSacTimeSeries()

      • makeFile

        public void makeFile(java.lang.String lastComp,
                     java.lang.String filename,
                     java.lang.String filemask,
                     java.util.ArrayList<MiniSeed> blks,
                     java.util.Date beg,
                     double duration,
                     java.lang.String[] args)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: Outputer
        the main routine gives an UNSORTED list in blks. If it needs to be sorted call Collections.sort(blks);
        Specified by:
        makeFile in class Outputer
        Parameters:
        lastComp - NNSSSSSCCCLL channel name
        filename - Filename for output
        filemask - The file mask with % operators for constructing a name (filename was derived from this)
        blks - The list of MiniSeed blocks to put into the output file
        beg - The beginning time of the time series
        duration - The duration of time series desired
        args - The original arguments to EdgeQueryClient so that additional args can be used by each outputer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
